hook.text: Populists say the 'real people' are being betrayed by corrupt elites. Left or right, the formula works.

buildup.text: Populism divides society into the pure people versus the corrupt elite. It claims to speak for the masses.

discovery.text: Trump, Orb√°n, Ch√°vez, and Podemos all used populist rhetoric. The ideology spans the political spectrum.

twist.text: Populism is a style, not a fixed policy set. It latches onto whatever grievance resonates with voters.

climax.text: Populism can expose real problems. But it often oversimplifies solutions and demonizes opponents.

punchline.text: Populists name real problems. Their solutions are another story.

quiz.question: What makes populism different from other ideologies?
options: It's a political style that can attach to left or right policies
It always supports free market economics
It only exists in developing countries
